title: The revelation just hit me today, if im doing decent by maining alll these flashy mechanics champs..
body:
... wont i rise several divisions by using press r to win ez mode champs? i used to main talon and shaco since i was first lvl 25 to like yesterday, and after they were both gutted its been difficult to consistentlly win on them like i used to. so then, i realized i can do so much more if i get fed as a mage then i can on talon or shaco. and i can do it more consinstentlly. why shouldnt i play annie, swain,hecarim, and vi instead?(rip my pathetic attempts to play yasuo well) as a mage if u get fed u can either burst one guy, have a cc plus range(wich beats mobility in defense) or dps the whole team.

if u get fed as shaco, to kill someone ud q behind them and aa, then e, but ull still need like 2 more backstabs and a chilling smite e to finish them ( y u gut my main rito) llate game if u q behind cait and aa her shes gonna just e u and kill u with her 1000 dmg basic attacks and bloodlust/bloodthirster,or buy time for her supp to help kill u. talon....ah my poor talon.... its sad when a already bad champ is riddled by fight breaking bugs thats all i have to say on that one

replies.body: or maybe you are doing decent just BECAUSE your champions are flashy and mechanical, and immobile champs cant keep up.
no actually(lol its hilarious that u would use that to discribe talon ) ive swapped to other champs and have been doing quite better

I hear ya, I used Lux for the first time after always calling her a no skill champ for the longest time...

I ended up like 30/4/7 or some B.S. like that by just hitting q, and a couple E's. It's just dumb.

considering that people do that in low sillver? lee is simply overloaded and too safe, hes like an assassin fighter cuz tld gives him free dmg early, ahri is ok cuz u have to land the skillshots, but ost of the champs in the game are predictable and telegraphed

Takin wasn't "bad" before the rework. Yes, there were some metas where assassins weren't as good, but most of the time he was fine. One-shorting people the second I hit six with just one rotation was pretty cancerous.
i never said talon pre rework was bad he was lit, hes bad now

My theory is that you aren't turning your advantage into map pressure, because you know how to play your champ but not play the game. And therefore if you switch to an "easy" champ, you'll have nothing going for you at all, and lose more.

actually ive been doing quite well recently(today) i use swain mid now, and keep talon as a pocket pick jg for immobile squishies comp like ashe vel and build hi, bruiser where he can do his job but not die beofre his passive is ready and can aa, http://na.op.gg/summoner/userName=omegaarab ( make sure to refresh)

There is this thing where if you don't like a champ or their playstyle you won't do well on them for very long.

Other than that caveat, yup, prettymuch.
